problems.title: Find the Second Largest Element
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an array of N integers. Your task is to find the second largest element in the array. If all elements are the same or the array has fewer than two distinct elements, print -1.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N (size of the array).
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format
Print the second largest element or -1 if it doesn't exist.

Example
Input: 5
10 20 4 45 99
Output: 45
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 10^5
-10^9 ≤ Array elements ≤ 10^9
Time Complexity: O(N)
Space Complexity: O(1)

starterCodes.code:
def findSecondLargest(arr, n):
    # TODO: Implement logic to find the second largest element
    return -1

def solve():
    import sys
    input = sys.stdin.read().split()
    if not input: return
    n = int(input[0])
    arr = list(map(int, input[1:]))
    print(findSecondLargest(arr, n))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    solve()

hintsList: Keep track of the largest and second largest elements while iterating through the array.

problems.title: Move All Zeroes to the End
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an array of N integers. Your task is to move all zeroes to the end of the array while maintaining the relative order of the non-zero elements.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N (size of the array).
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format
Print the modified array elements separated by spaces.

Example
Input: 5
0 1 0 3 12
Output: 1 3 12 0 0
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 10^5
-10^9 ≤ Array elements ≤ 10^9
Time Complexity: O(N)
Space Complexity: O(1)

def moveZeroes(arr, n):
    # TODO: Move all zeroes to the end in-place
    return arr

def solve():
    import sys
    input = sys.stdin.read().split()
    if not input: return
    n = int(input[0])
    arr = list(map(int, input[1:]))
    result = moveZeroes(arr, n)
    print(*(result))

if __name__ == '__main__':

problems.title: Find the Missing Number
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an array of N-1 integers in the range of 1 to N. Each integer appears exactly once except for one number which is missing. Your task is to find the missing number.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N-1 (number of elements in the array).
The second line contains N-1 space-separated integers.

Output Format
Print the missing number.

Example
Input: 4
1 2 4 5
Output: 3
Explanation: N is 5, and the missing number in range 1 to 5 is 3.
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 10^5
1 ≤ Array elements ≤ N
Time Complexity: O(N)
Space Complexity: O(1)

starterCodes.code:
def findMissingNumber(arr, n_minus_1):
    # TODO: Find the missing number in range 1 to N
    return -1

def solve():
    import sys
    input = sys.stdin.read().split()
    if not input: return
    n_minus_1 = int(input[0])
    arr = list(map(int, input[1:]))
    print(findMissingNumber(arr, n_minus_1))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    solve()

hintsList: Calculate the sum of the first N natural numbers and subtract the sum of the array elements.

problems.title: Check if Array is Sorted
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an array of N integers. Your task is to check if the array is sorted in non-decreasing order. If it is sorted, print YES, otherwise print NO.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N (size of the array).
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format
Print YES or NO.

Example
Input: 5
1 2 3 4 5
Output: YES
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 10^5
-10^9 ≤ Array elements ≤ 10^9
Time Complexity: O(N)
Space Complexity: O(1)

starterCodes.code:
def isSorted(arr, n):
    # TODO: Return YES if sorted, else NO
    return "NO"

def solve():
    import sys
    input = sys.stdin.read().split()
    if not input: return
    n = int(input[0])
    arr = list(map(int, input[1:]))
    print(isSorted(arr, n))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    solve()

hintsList: Iterate through the array and check if every element is less than or equal to the next element.

problems.title: Find the Element that Appears Once
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an array of N integers where every element appears exactly twice except for one element which appears only once. Your task is to find that single element.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N (size of the array).
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format
Print the element that appears once.

Example
Input: 5
1 1 2 2 3
Output: 3
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 10^5
-10^9 ≤ Array elements ≤ 10^9
Time Complexity: O(N)
Space Complexity: O(1)
